question_text:
During hockey season, Lili stays in excellent shape. To keep up her conditioning in the off-season, she swims every day.

There is a proportional relationship between the time (in seconds) Lili swims freestyle (x) and the number of feet she travels (y).

Write an equation for the relationship between x and y. Simplify any fractions.
y=_
backend_description: A graph showing the proportional relationship between time swimming freestyle in seconds (x-axis) and distance traveled in feet (y-axis). The line passes through the origin and the point (1, 3), indicating a constant rate of 3 feet per second.
solution_image_tag: Shows the graph with the point (1, 3) clearly marked. This point helps students calculate the constant of proportionality by finding y/x = 3/1 = 3 feet per second.
solution: To write an equation for the relationship between x and y, first find the constant of proportionality. Start by identifying the coordinates of one of the points on the line.
Calculate the ratio of the y-coordinate to the x-coordinate.
$\frac{y}{x} = \frac{3}{1} = 3$. The constant of proportionality is 3 feet per second.
The equation for the relationship is y=3x.

solution: To write an equation for the relationship between x and y, first find the constant of proportionality. Start by identifying the coordinates of one of the points on the line.
Calculate the ratio of the y-coordinate to the x-coordinate.
$\frac{y}{x} = \frac{11}{1} = 11$. The constant of proportionality is 11 per second.
The equation for the relationship is y=11x.
